episodeTitle: Tashigi's Tears! G-5's Desperate Breakthrough Plan!
episodeTitleJapanese: たしぎの涙 G5決死の突破作戦
episodeTitleRomanized: Tashigi no Namida - Jī-Faibu Kesshi no Toppa Sakusen
description: Caesar Clown unleashes his deadly plan to trap the intruders by sealing the passage between Buildings A and B, then flooding Building A with the poisonous gas Shinokuni. In a desperate race against time, the Straw Hats and G-5 Marines rush toward the closing gate as the deadly gas spreads. Several brave G-5 Marines sacrifice themselves to ensure Tashigi's escape, giving their lives to save their captain.

events.title: Caesar's Deadly Trap Activated
events.description: Caesar Clown, enraged by the intruders escaping within his laboratory, orders the passage between Buildings A and B to be sealed shut. He plans to release Shinokuni poison gas into Building A to kill everyone trapped inside.
events.significance: This decision sets the stage for the desperate escape attempt and the subsequent sacrifice of the G-5 Marines. It demonstrates Caesar's ruthlessness and willingness to kill indiscriminately.

quotes.text: Close the passage between Buildings A and B! Let Shinokuni flow in and kill them all!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar ordering his subordinates to trap and kill the intruders

events.title: Vergo Decides to Handle Intruders Personally
events.description: Despite Caesar's plan, Vergo decides he will take care of the intruders himself rather than relying solely on the poison gas trap.
events.significance: This foreshadows Vergo's direct confrontation with the heroes in the following episodes and shows his confidence in his own abilities.

events.title: Chopper Sneaks Out to Find the Children
events.description: Chopper, who had been eavesdropping on Caesar's plans, sneaks out of the room and tries to navigate the labyrinthine laboratory to find the captive children.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's determination to save the children and sets up his independent subplot within the larger escape sequence.

events.title: Monet Observes Chopper's Escape
events.description: Monet, monitoring the situation in Building A, glances in Chopper's direction as he runs out of the room but does not immediately pursue or alert others.
events.significance: Shows Monet's awareness of the situation and possibly hints at her confidence that the intruders won't escape anyway.

events.title: The Gate Begins to Close
events.description: An alarm sounds throughout Building A, indicating that the gate between Buildings A and B has begun to close. Luffy, Smoker, and Law are the first to cross through before the alarm sounds.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the desperate race against time that defines the episode's tension and leads to the Marines' sacrifice.

events.title: Tashigi Orders Marines to Let Straw Hats Pass
events.description: Upon hearing the alarm, Tashigi quickly assesses the situation and orders her G-5 Marines to stop fighting the Straw Hats and instead hurry toward the closing gate together.
events.significance: This demonstrates Tashigi's leadership and practical decision-making under pressure. She prioritizes survival over continuing their rivalry with pirates, showing the bonds forming between the unlikely allies.

quotes.text: Forget the Straw Hats! Everyone hurry to the gate!
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi ordering her marines to prioritize escape over fighting

events.title: Machete Run's Debut and Defeat
events.description: Inside Building A, Luffy encounters the guard to Building B, a large man known as 'Machete' Run. Luffy promptly defeats him with a single Gear Second-enhanced kick without breaking stride.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's overwhelming power at this point in the series and his ability to deal with minor obstacles efficiently. Also shows how the time skip training has made previously challenging fights trivial.

events.title: The Wall is Destroyed - Shinokuni Floods In
events.description: Outside the laboratory, a cannon fires and blows apart the wall of Building A. The deadly poison gas Shinokuni immediately begins flowing into the building, petrifying everything it touches.
events.significance: This is the moment where the threat becomes real and immediate. The visual of the poison gas flowing in creates the episode's most intense moments of danger.

events.title: G-5 Marines Begin to be Petrified
events.description: As Shinokuni floods into Building A, some of the slower G-5 Marines at the back of the group are caught by the poison gas. They begin to be petrified, their bodies turning to stone as the rest of the group desperately tries to reach the gate.
events.significance: This shows the deadly nature of Shinokuni and raises the stakes of the escape. The visual of marines being slowly petrified as they run is one of the arc's most haunting images.

events.title: The G-5 Marines' Ultimate Sacrifice
events.description: As the gate nears closing, most of the Straw Hats and Marines make it through safely. However, Tashigi is still behind. Several G-5 Marines forcibly throw Tashigi through the gate despite her protests, choosing to stay behind and be consumed by Shinokuni rather than let their captain die. They give thumbs up and peace signs as they are petrified, creating monuments to their bravery.
events.significance: This is the emotional climax of the episode and one of the most powerful moments in the Punk Hazard arc. It completely transforms the perception of the G-5 Marines from rough criminals to heroes willing to sacrifice themselves for their captain. The visual of them frozen in encouraging poses becomes iconic.

quotes.text: Captain Tashigi! Keep going! Don't look back!
quotes.speaker: G-5 Marine
quotes.context: The marines encouraging Tashigi as they sacrifice themselves

events.title: Tashigi's Tears
events.description: Safe on the other side of the gate, Tashigi watches helplessly as the Marines who saved her are petrified by Shinokuni. She breaks down in tears, devastated by the loss of her subordinates who gave their lives to save hers.
events.significance: This moment gives the episode its title and serves as a powerful character moment for Tashigi. It shows her deep care for her subordinates and the weight of command. The scene resonates because these were rough, criminal marines who showed the truest form of loyalty.

quotes.text: Close the passage between Buildings A and B! Let Shinokuni flow in and kill them all!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar ordering his subordinates to trap and kill the intruders

quotes.text: Forget the Straw Hats! Everyone hurry to the gate!
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi ordering her marines to prioritize escape over fighting

quotes.text: Captain Tashigi! Keep going! Don't look back!
quotes.speaker: G-5 Marine
quotes.context: The marines encouraging Tashigi as they sacrifice themselves

themes.description: The episode's central theme explores the ultimate sacrifice as the G-5 Marines give their lives to save their captain. Despite being portrayed earlier as rough and morally questionable individuals, they demonstrate the highest form of loyalty and selflessness.
themes.symbolism: The frozen marines giving thumbs up and peace signs symbolize their acceptance of death and their final act of encouragement to the survivors. They literally become monuments to bravery.

themes.description: Tashigi's tears represent the burden of command. She must live with the knowledge that her subordinates died to save her, a weight that defines leadership in dangerous circumstances.
themes.symbolism: Tashigi's tears are not just grief but also represent the heavy responsibility of being a leader who survives when her subordinates do not.

themes.description: The Marines and Pirates working together to escape shows how extreme circumstances can forge bonds between enemies. Tashigi's order to stop fighting the Straw Hats demonstrates pragmatic leadership.
The episode contrasts Caesar's callous disregard for life with the G-5 Marines' willingness to sacrifice themselves for others. This highlights the moral gulf between villain and hero.

characterSpotlights.development: Tashigi demonstrates strong leadership under pressure but is ultimately forced to confront the cost of that leadership when her subordinates sacrifice themselves for her. This deepens her character and shows the weight of command.
keyActions: Orders marines to stop fighting Straw Hats and flee
Attempts to stay behind with her marines
Is forcibly thrown through the gate by her subordinates
Breaks down crying as she witnesses their sacrifice
quotes: Forget the Straw Hats! Everyone hurry to the gate!

characterSpotlights.development: Caesar's cruelty and disregard for life is on full display as he callously orders the deaths of everyone in Building A, including his own subordinates caught in the trap.
keyActions: Orders the passage between buildings sealed
Commands Shinokuni be released into Building A
Shows no remorse for the deaths caused
quotes: Close the passage between Buildings A and B! Let Shinokuni flow in and kill them all!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his post-timeskip strength by effortlessly defeating Run without breaking stride in the escape.
keyActions: Crosses the gate before the alarm sounds
Defeats Machete Run with a Gear Second kick

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the fight sequences and the escape sequence, adding more time to show the marines running and the spreading of Shinokuni.
In the manga, Tashigi's escape happened slightly differently with less emphasis on her trying to go back, whereas the anime added more emotional beats to her reluctance to abandon her men.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts One Piece Chapter 679, which is titled 'The Audacity of G-5' in the manga, highlighting the bravery of the G-5 Marines.
The episode aired on July 20, 2013 for the US simulcast and July 21, 2013 in Japan, achieving a TV rating of 8.5% in Japan (Rank 3).

The G-5 Marines' sacrifice scene, with them frozen in encouraging poses, became one of the most memorable and emotional moments of the Punk Hazard arc, completely changing fans' perception of the G-5 unit.
Bakezo is specifically named as one of the marines who participated in the sacrifice to save Tashigi.
This episode marks the first major character debut with Run (Machete Run), who is immediately defeated by Luffy, showcasing the power difference between pre and post-timeskip Luffy.
